hook.text: A child washes their hands until they bleed. It's not quirky â€” it's OCD.

buildup.text: OCD causes intrusive unwanted thoughts and repetitive behaviors to neutralize anxiety.

discovery.text: It often begins in childhood, with the average age of onset between 8 and 12.

twist.text: Children often hide their rituals out of shame, delaying diagnosis by years.

climax.text: Exposure and Response Prevention (ERP) is highly effective for childhood OCD.

punchline.text: The rituals look like the solution. They're actually the prison.
